programme.desc: The chef heads to Scotland, starting his journey on the Isle of Mull, where he searches for mussels, before visiting the UK's largest mussel farm in Inverlussa. programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second leg of the semi-final, held at Anfield. Liverpool manager Arne Slot has enjoyed an excellent first campaign in charge so far, leading the way in the Premier League for much of the season and qualifying for the last 16 of the Champions League with ease, but they lost the first leg of this contest 1-0 at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, with Lucas Bergvall scoring the goal. Spurs' struggles in the Premier League this season made that result in the opening leg all the more surprising, but they will be hopeful of holding onto their slender lead after already eliminating Manchester City and Manchester United in the competition. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Robbie Fowler and Les Ferdinand

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson takes a look at the highs and lows of the small screen, unpicking popular events and unearthing wonderful hidden gems. programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester United v Leicester City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening tie of the fourth round, held at Old Trafford. United have struggled in the Premier League so far this season, but are the holders of this competition and eliminated Arsenal on penalties at Emirates Stadium in the previous round. Leicester are also enduring a difficult top-flight campaign this term and are now managed by Ruud van Nistelrooy, who briefly served United as caretaker manager earlier this season. They progressed to this stage after thrashing Queens Park Rangers 6-2 lifted this trophy for the first time in their history four years ago, eliminating the Red Devils en route. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The eight bad boyfriends are sent to Brozone, where they must go back to basics. The first relationship test discovers how well the boys know their girlfriends.

programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the remaining nine celebrities perform routines with their professional skating partners to songs that have personal meaning to them in order to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by Angela Rippon and Gary Kemp and Camilla Bassett-Smith shares her favourite flowers to plant this time of year. Jekka McVicar brews some homemade 'love potions' and farmer Tom Davis demonstrates how he gets his purebred poultry competition-ready. Jaega Wise shares her favourite winter-warming beers

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by former EastEnders star Tracy-Ann Oberman and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster who serve up some delicious recipes of their own

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the south-eastern town of Annecy, where he wanders around its market to select ingredients for his first cook. On the stunning shore of its crystal clear lake, James cooks dishes showcasing delicious local tomatoes, red mullet and lobster. He then visits award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample some of his extraordinary creations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Sunderland v Watford at Stadium of Light, West Bromwich Albion v Sheffield Wednesday at The Hawthorns and Sheffield United v Portsmouth at Bramall Lane in the Championship

programme.title: The Murder of Olly Stephens: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Olly Stephens was fatally stabbed just metres from his home. This documentary exposes the chilling online plot carried out by his young killers who were inspired by the glorification of knives and gang culture they found on social media. This horrific crime in an affluent part of Reading shocked a community and left Olly's devastated parents searching for answers

programme.desc: Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second leg of the semi-final, held at Anfield. Liverpool manager Arne Slot has enjoyed an excellent first campaign in charge so far, leading the way in the Premier League for much of the season and qualifying for the last 16 of the Champions League with ease, but they lost the first leg of this contest 1-0 at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, with Lucas Bergvall scoring the goal. Spurs' struggles in the Premier League this season made that result in the opening leg all the more surprising, but they will be hopeful of holding onto their slender lead after already eliminating Manchester City and Manchester United in the competition. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Robbie Fowler and Les Ferdinand

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester United v Leicester City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening tie of the fourth round, held at Old Trafford. United have struggled in the Premier League so far this season, but are the holders of this competition and eliminated Arsenal on penalties at Emirates Stadium in the previous round. Leicester are also enduring a difficult top-flight campaign this term and are now managed by Ruud van Nistelrooy, who briefly served United as caretaker manager earlier this season. They progressed to this stage after thrashing Queens Park Rangers 6-2 lifted this trophy for the first time in their history four years ago, eliminating the Red Devils en route. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by former EastEnders star Tracy-Ann Oberman and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster who serve up some delicious recipes of their own

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the south-eastern town of Annecy, where he wanders around its market to select ingredients for his first cook. On the stunning shore of its crystal clear lake, James cooks dishes showcasing delicious local tomatoes, red mullet and lobster. He then visits award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample some of his extraordinary creations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.desc: Highlights from the first series of Love Your Weekend, featuring interviews with property expert Phil Spencer and actress Sarah Parish, a guide to identifying bird songs, and a selection of the best British craft beers

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which three pairs of contestants use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. Crossing words against the reigning champions this time are mother and daughter Valerie and Sarah and siblings Michael and Shanice

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Matt gets his opportunity to open the iconic red boxes - in the game show with only one question, will Matt say 'Deal' or 'No deal' when faced with the Banker's tempting offers or choose to take home what's inside his randomly selected box instead?

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Sarah from Braintree, Arash originally from Kidderminster, Suzanne from Nottingham and James from Burton-on-Trent take on a Chaser. Bradley Walsh guides the contestants through a battle of wits in the hope that they'll go home with thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Leyla opens up, Charity makes a discovery, and Dawn is tempted

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester United v Leicester City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening tie of the fourth round, held at Old Trafford. United have struggled in the Premier League so far this season, but are the holders of this competition and eliminated Arsenal on penalties at Emirates Stadium in the previous round. Leicester are also enduring a difficult top-flight campaign this term and are now managed by Ruud van Nistelrooy, who briefly served United as caretaker manager earlier this season. They progressed to this stage after thrashing Queens Park Rangers 6-2 lifted this trophy for the first time in their history four years ago, eliminating the Red Devils en route. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The eight bad boyfriends are sent to Brozone, where they must go back to basics. The first relationship test discovers how well the boys know their girlfriends.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which three pairs of contestants use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing. Crossing words with the reigning champions this time are married couple Mala and Michael, and friends Heather and Emily

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Join Stephen Mulhern as Matt gets his opportunity to open the iconic red boxes - in the game show with only one question, will Matt say 'Deal' or 'No deal' when faced with the Banker's tempting offers or choose to take home what's inside his randomly selected box instead?

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the remaining nine celebrities perform routines with their professional skating partners to songs that have personal meaning to them in order to impress the judges and avoid elimination

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by Angela Rippon and Gary Kemp and Camilla Bassett-Smith shares her favourite flowers to plant this time of year. Jekka McVicar brews some homemade 'love potions' and farmer Tom Davis demonstrates how he gets his purebred poultry competition-ready. Jaega Wise shares her favourite winter-warming beers

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home by former EastEnders star Tracy-Ann Oberman and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster who serve up some delicious recipes of their own

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: Restaurateur Nisha Katona presents a cooking series set in the Wirral on England's west coast as she shares her passion for good food and cooks dishes inspired by her family and heritage from her own outdoor kitchen. She begins with a chicken dhansak, a green bean and mango dal bunny chow and a Hungarian family favourite of layered cabbage with paprika pork mince. Plus, an insight into what a farrier does

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the south-eastern town of Annecy, where he wanders around its market to select ingredients for his first cook. On the stunning shore of its crystal clear lake, James cooks dishes showcasing delicious local tomatoes, red mullet and lobster. He then visits award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample some of his extraordinary creations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Stadio Olimpico. The teams last met in the final round of the 2024 competition. when Italy claimed 24-21 victory at Principality Stadium. That result left Wales with the Wooden Spoon after losing all five of their matches for the first time since 2003, while the Azzurri's two victories and a draw represented their best ever showing in the Six Nations. Analysis from Dan Biggar, Jamie Roberts and Sergio Parisse, reports by Claire Thomas, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman and Shane Williams

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. France have won the last three meetings between the teams, including a narrow 33-31 victory in Lyon last year and an emphatic 53-10 triumph here in 2023, which was France's biggest-ever winning margin against England and the hosts' heaviest home defeat of all time. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Eddie Jones and Brian O'Driscoll, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Benjamin Kayser

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the five Masked Singers perform in the semi-final and a double elimination chooses the three finalists. Richard E Grant joins the judges panel

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: Abigail closes the trade deal with her Australian counterpart while pushing Greg behind in the race just days before the election. As the final clue reveals Sophie's killer leaving everyone shell-shocked, Meg and Max have to decide what justice looks like in this case and Max is forced to choose what he'd like his own future to look like

programme.desc: Guy Martin and a team from the Black Country Living Museum restore a Newcomen engine, an 18th-century steam-powered device used principally to pump water out of mines.

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great Escape
programme.desc: The motoring enthusiast sets out to recreate the iconic motorcycle stunt at the climax of the 1963 film The Great Escape - and succeed where Steve McQueen failed.

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: The Enemy Within: HMS Queen Elizabeth stops off in Cyprus, but a sailor contracts Covid-19 while on shore leave and the virus spreads quickly leaving nearly 400 crew in isolation.

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: Pride of the Fleet: In the South China Sea, the warship launches anti-submarine helicopters to see off an unwelcome visit from the Chinese Navy.

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve embarks on the third leg of his four-part journey around the Mediterranean, travelling through Libya, Tunisia and across the sea to Sicily.

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve embarks on the final leg of his journey around the Mediterranean, travelling from Morocco, across the sea to Spain, and on to Corsica and the French Riviera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Gestapo Ruins a Picnic: 1980s sitcom that finds farcical fun in the French Resistance. Von Klinkerhoffen wants to use the local newspaper for Nazi propaganda and asks Rene to run it.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Spirit of Nouvion: Another merry trip to wartime France. Michelle enlists Rene to try to retrieve the Fallen Madonna locked in Herr Flick's safe. What could possibly go wrong!?
